intro: Pittocaulon bombycophole, commonly known as the silkyleaf pittocaulon, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, broad leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
